title.value: Workflow Discovery from Dialogues in the Low Data Regime
title.justification: The title is explicitly mentioned at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: Workflow Discovery from Dialogues in the Low Data Regime

extractions.description: The paper presents a new problem formulation called Workflow Discovery (WD) focused on extracting workflows from text-based dialogues in task-oriented settings. The goal is to summarize dialogues by extracting sequences of agent actions and slot values to guide future interactions.

type.justification: The study involves experiments and evaluations on models using datasets to present a solution to the Workflow Discovery problem.
type.quote: We present experiments where we extract workflows from dialogues in the Action-Based Conversations Dataset (ABCD).

name.justification: The paper's primary research field is Natural Language Processing as it deals with dialogue systems and extracting workflows from text-based dialogues.
name.quote: Text-based dialogues are now widely used to solve real-world problems.

name.justification: The paper examines a sequence-to-sequence (Seq2Seq) approach for the Workflow Discovery task and evaluates various Seq2Seq models.
name.quote: We also examine a sequence-to-sequence (Seq2Seq) approach for this novel task.

name.justification: The research focuses on task-oriented dialogues and extracting workflows from such dialogues, making dialogue systems a key sub-field.
name.quote: Task-oriented dialogues are ubiquitous in everyday life and customer service in particular.

name.justification: The paper draws comparisons and builds on the concept of Action State Tracking (AST) to address the Workflow Discovery problem.
name.quote: WD could be seen as a generalization of the recently proposed notion of Action State Tracking (AST).

name.justification: T5 models of different sizes are evaluated for the Workflow Discovery task and other related tasks such as AST and CDS.
name.quote: In our experimentation, we used the T5 (Raffel et al., 2020b)...we use the small (60M parameters), base (220M parameters), and large (770M parameters) variants.

is_contributed.justification: T5 is a well-established model and is not a contribution of this paper.
is_contributed.quote: In our experimentation, we used the T5 (Raffel et al., 2020b)...

is_executed.justification: The T5 model was executed in the experiments conducted in this paper.
is_executed.quote: In our experimentation, we used the T5...

is_compared.justification: The performance of T5 was compared with other models in the context of the Workflow Discovery task.
is_compared.quote: We test our approach using various state-of-the-art text-to-text models and show its efficacy...

referenced_paper_title.value: Exploring the limits of transfer learning with a unified text-to-text transformer
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the referenced paper for the T5 model used in the experiments.
referenced_paper_title.quote: In our experimentation, we used the T5 (Raffel et al., 2020b)...

name.justification: The ABCD dataset is used extensively for experiments and evaluations in the study.
name.quote: We test our approach using various state-of-the-art text-to-text models and show its efficacy on the Action Based Conversations Dataset (ABCD).

referenced_paper_title.value: Action-based conversations dataset: A corpus for building more in-depth task-oriented dialogue systems
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper provides the dataset used for evaluations.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Action-based conversations dataset: A corpus for building more in-depth task-oriented dialogue systems. North American Chapter of the ACL (NAACL), 2021.

name.justification: The MultiWOZ dataset is used for cross-dataset evaluations and few-shot experiments in the study.
name.quote: ... yielding good cross-dataset zero-shot workflow extraction performance... relevant results on MultiWOZ dataset.

referenced_paper_title.value: Multiwoz–a large-scale multi-domain wizard-of-oz dataset for task-oriented dialogue modelling
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper provides the dataset used for evaluations.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Multiwoz–a large-scale multi-domain wizard-of-oz dataset for task-oriented dialogue modelling. Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing (EMNLP), 2018.

name.justification: The Huggingface Transformers library is used for implementing and managing the models evaluated in the study.
name.quote: We use the Huggingface Transformers Pytorch implementation... for all model variants.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper describes the library used in the study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Transformers: State-of-the-Art Natural Language Processing. arXiv, 2019.
